results.title: 1976 kayak canoe Olympics. No. 13
results.brief_description: Part thirteen of a series which record the last three days of heats, repercharges and semi-finals of the 1976 Olympic Canoe and Kayak races in Montreal, 1976. Excellent for stroke analysis and coaching, as it includes slow motion close-ups of the best paddlers in the world. The 500m and 1000m finals are shown. Photographed by Dr. Stan Plagenhoef.

results.title: 1975: War of the flea: 1979: god fights back: 1989: people power: 1997: fast forward
results.creator_credit: BBC, WGBH (Boston), Bill Treharne Jones, Dominic Ozanne, Ben Loeterman, Angus MacQueen and Archie Baron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “People’s century: 1900-1999”.
This tape contains episodes twenty three to twenty six of the ‘People’s century 1900-1999’ series. 1975: WAR OF THE FLEA; success by guerilla fighters in Cuba, Vietnam and Afghanistan are used to illustrate how minority groups were able to overthrown government authorities, and are united by their religious idealogy and the uneasy peace that followed their actions. Narrated by Sean Barrett. 1979: GOD FIGHTS BACK; the secular liberalism of many Middle Eastern, African and Asian countries is rejected as the Ayatollah Khomeini’s Iranian revolution inspires Muslims to seek fundamentalist Islamic governments. Narrated by Sean Barrett. 1989: PEOPLE POWER; from the 1980 strike in Poland’s Gdansk Shipyard to the army’s attempt to lay siege to the Russian White House, eyewitnesses from an historic era recall the fall of the Eastern Bloc. Narrated by Veronika Hyks. 1997: FAST FORWARD; the collapse of Communism and the end of the Cold War heralds a new era of global capitalism. It also brought with it a bloody price, as resurging nationalism and old animosity brought forward ethnic violence, and an increasing divide between rich and poor brought social unrest. What will the twenty first century bring? Narrated by Sean Barrett.

results.creator_credit: Atlantic Productions, Daniel Grodnik, Bill Badalato and Ernest Thompson
results.brief_description: It was the end of high school and nearing the end of an era when teenage friends Scott (Kiefer Sutherland) and Ralph (Robert Downey Jr) face the full brunt of events in society at the time - the war in Vietnam, Neil Armstrong walking on the moon, and a boom in hippie culture. Scott, a pacifist, has a brother in Vietnam and clashes with his father over his views. Ralph seems to be avoiding the issue through drugs - much to the chagrin of Scott, and Scott’s younger sister, Beth (Winona Ryder), who takes on a bigger role in their lives. In the space of one Summer, two families are drawn together by love, death and war, changing their relationship to one another and society irrevocably. Features a soundtrack of classic 60’s music. Cast also includes Bruce Dern and Mariette Hartley.

results.creator_credit: Clavius Base, Imagine Entertainment (US), Brian Grazer, Ron Howard and Michael Bostick
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
In a year marked by anti-Vietnam war prtesets, when Russia seemed ready to send a man to the moon, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders prepare for the launch of Apollo 8, the first ever manned voyage to the moon. Their aim is to reach the moon and remain in lunar orbit, the greatest risk is that they have a single engine that must break their orbit if it is to bring them home safely.
